message.content:
cs.CC, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.CS, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the complexity of Boolean circuits, which is a central topic in computational complexity theory. The use of uniform classes and the study of the power of simple-looking circuits suggest that the paper belongs to cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The focus on the characterization of languages reducible to uniform families of OR and AND circuits suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). The use of directed graphs and reachability questions suggests that the paper may belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The study of the computational power of these circuits in terms of known uniform machine-based complexity classes suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.CS (Computer Science and Game Theory) and cs.IT (Information Theory).
